ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:0.5_0: Venerables, these eight rules on acknowledgment come up for recitation.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.2_0: the nuns from the group of six were eating ghee that they had asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.4_0: “How can nuns eat ghee that they have asked for?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.5_0: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.6_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.7_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.8_0: “How can the nuns from the group of six eat ghee that they have asked for?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.12_0: “... How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.14_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.15.1_0: ‘If a nun eats ghee that she has asked for, she must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.16_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.17_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.1_0: Soon afterwards a number of nuns were sick.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.2_0: The nuns who were looking after them asked,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.3_0: “I hope you’re bearing up, Venerable, I hope you’re getting better?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.4_0: “Previously we ate ghee that we had asked for, and then we were comfortable.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.5_0: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.6_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.7_0: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to eat ghee that she has asked for.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.8_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.9.1_0: ‘If a nun who is not sick asks for ghee and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.10_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.8_0: who is not comfortable without ghee.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.10_0: milk from cows, milk from goats, milk from buffaloes, or cows. And ghee or oil.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.11_0: If he is not sick and he asks for himself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.12_0: When he receives it with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.13_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.1_0: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she eats ghee that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.2_0: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she eats ghee that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.3_0: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she eats ghee that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.4_0: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.5_0: If she is sick, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.6_0: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.3_0: if she asked for it when she was sick, but eats it when she is no longer sick;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.4_0: if she eats the leftovers from one who is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.7_0: if it is built for someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.8_0: if it is by means of her own property;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.10_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.11_0: The first training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
